attr.q:
Let X and Y be two independent discrete random variables with the following PMFs:

P_X(k) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l l} \frac{1}{4} & \quad \text{for } k=1\\ \frac{1}{8} & \quad \text{for } k=2\\ \frac{1}{8} & \quad \text{for } k=3\\ \frac{1}{2} & \quad \text{for } k=4\\ 0 & \quad \text{otherwise} \end{array} \right.

and

P_Y(k) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l l} \frac{1}{6} & \quad \text{for } k=1\\ \frac{1}{6} & \quad \text{for } k=2\\ \frac{1}{3} & \quad \text{for } k=3\\ \frac{1}{3} & \quad \text{for } k=4\\ 0 & \quad \text{otherwise} \end{array} \right.

attr.a:
Because X and Y are independent

\begin{aligned} &P(X\leq 2 \textrm{ and } Y\leq 2) \\ &=P(X\leq 2)P(Y\leq 2) \\ &=(P_X(1) + P_X(2))(P_Y(1) + P_Y(2)) \\ &=({1 \over 4} + {1 \over 8})({1 \over 6} + {1 \over 6}) \\ &=({3 \over 8})({1 \over 3}) \\ &={17 \over 24} \\ \end{aligned}

Because X and Y are independent

P(X >2 | Y > 2) \\ = P(X >2) \\ = P_X(3) + P_X(4) \\ = {1 \over 8} + {1 \over 2} \\ = {5 \over 8} \\

\begin{aligned} &P\left( X <Y\right) \\ &=P\left( X=1,Y=2\right) +P\left( X=1,Y=3\right) +P\left( X=1,Y=4\right) +P\left( X=2,Y=3\right) +P\left( X=2,Y=4\right) +P\left( X=3,Y=4\right) \\ &=P_{X}\left( 1\right) P_{Y}\left( 2\right) +P_X \left( 1\right) P_{Y}\left( 3\right) +P_{X}\left( 1\right) P_{Y}\left( 4\right) +P_{X}\left( 2\right) P_{Y}\left( 3\right) +P_{X}\left( 2\right) P_{Y}\left( 4\right) +P_{X}\left( 3\right) P_{Y}\left( 4\right) \\ &=\dfrac{1}{4}\ast \dfrac{1}{6}+\dfrac{1}{4}\ast \dfrac{1}{3}+\dfrac{1}{4}\ast \dfrac{1}{3}+\dfrac{1}{8}\ast \dfrac{1}{3}+\dfrac{1}{8}\ast \dfrac{1}{3}+\dfrac{1}{2}\ast \dfrac{1}{3}\\ &=\dfrac{1}{24}+\dfrac{1}{12}+\dfrac{1}{12}+\dfrac{1}{24}+\dfrac{1}{24}+\dfrac{1}{6}\\ &=\dfrac{11}{24} \end{aligned}

This is complement of the (a).

P(X > 2 \textrm{ or } Y > 2) \\ =1 - P(X\leq 2 \textrm{ and } Y\leq 2) \\ = 1-{17 \over 24} = {7 \over 24}
